page.title: 13PUBLIC HOUSES & RESTAURANTS
page.content: There is very little organised { {RECREATION}and{ENTERTAINMENT}in the area. Many people like to spend an evening at a {PUBLIC HOUSE}or "Pub". It is customary for people to play skittles if the "Pub" has a "skittle alley". "The Cross Inn" at the upper end of{Avening}High Street is just such a "Pub". This establishment has an off-licence and is supplied by Whitbread Breweries in Gloucester. The only other public house in the block is the "Troublehouse" on the Tetbury to Cirencester road (London Road). There were, however, two other public houses several years ago: "The Butchers Arms" in Point Road is now a house and the "Bell Inn" at the end of New Inn Lane is now the "Gibbons Restaurant". The latter specializes in high class cuisine and caters for people from as far away as Bristol.
